data.title: Eastern State Penitentiary
data.meta_description: Eastern State Penitentiary was once the most famous and expensive prison in the world, but stands today in ruin, a haunting world of crumbling cellblocks and empty guard towers. Its vaulted, sky-lit cells once held many of Americas most notorious criminals...
data.text:
Plan Your Visit

Eastern State Penitentiary Historic Site is currently open daily from 10:00 am to 5:00 pm. We are closed on the following holidays: Thanksgiving, Christmas Eve, Christmas Day, and New Year’s Day.

Learn more

September 17, 2024, 6:30 pm – 7:30 pm

Justice 101 — Establishing Justice: Excessive Punishment and Mass Incarceration

Free. In Person & Online. Advanced registration required. In partnership with The Free Library of Philadelphia and the Brennan Center for Justice, join us as we unpack why our criminal justice system is so punitive, examine the harms of the status quo, and offer insight into how we as a society can move toward a more effective and humane criminal justice system. Learn more

Help Us Redefine Justice in America

Eastern State has entered a bold new era, and one of the pillars of our future is to become the national leader in criminal justice education. Together, we can learn and foster meaningful action and productive change – in our communities, our society, and in ourselves.

Make a Gift
